document_data.caption: Adara, in the dim light of Wheloon.
document_data.name: Adara Semple
document_data.mainbody: ara was a light-skinned [[human]] woman who wore her blonde hair tied back. In the field, she wore a suit of [[chain mail]], and carried a [[buckler]] and [[mace]]-like [[holy symbol]] of Amaunator.
document_data.Description: Adara was a light-skinned [[human]] woman who wore her blonde hair tied back. In the field, she wore a suit of [[chain mail]], and carried a [[buckler]] and [[mace]]-like [[holy symbol]] of Amaunator.
document_data.Personality: Adara was an extremely upbeat and cheerful woman, and sought only to help and uplift others (such as by smiting [[evil]]).
document_data.History:
{{quote
|One more victory for the forces of good!
|Adara, triumphant}}
Like many other priests of Amaunator including [[Dai Rolno]] and [[Maribe Banro]], Adara was deeply concerned by the conditions inside [[Wheloon]]. She managed to gain entrance into the city (possibly with the aid of her comrade [[Karie Leddle]]) and found her way to [[Harvest Hall]], where the [[Wheloon natives]] managed and protected their own part of the prison. From there, Adara sought assistance in investigating [[Shar Manor]], a stronghold of the [[Shadovar]] that she believed held a great threat. On reaching the Manor, she found a ritual being cast by a [[Sharran]] priest to extend the [[Shadowfell]]'s local influence further via the [[Shadowfell Nexus]], and slew the ritualist, thwarting one small part of the [[Netherese]] plans.
